    A

    abs() - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies absolute value (|x|) to the top tensor in the queue. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    abs(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies absolute value (|x|) to the specified tensor. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    abs(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies absolute value (|x|) to the specified tensor and stores the result under a new name. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    add() - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise addition (a + b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    add(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise addition (a + b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    add(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise addition (a + b) using the two specified tensors. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    add(String, String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise addition (a + b) using the two specified tensors and stores the result. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    affine() - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c. Ensure the last axis of tensor a matches the second-to-last axis of tensor b for valid dot product. Tensor c must have the same size as the number of columns in the resulting matrix (i.e., last axis of b). Broadcasting is allowed for tensor c; its broadcasting setting does not affect correctness. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    affine(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified input tensor a. The dot product a · b requires the last axis of a to match the second-to-last axis of b. Tensor c must match the output column size (last axis of b), and may be broadcasted. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    affine(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified tensors a and b. Ensure the last axis of a equals the second-to-last axis of b for valid matrix multiplication. Tensor c must match the number of columns in b and may be broadcasted if needed. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    affine(String, String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified tensors a, b, and c. Valid dot product requires last axis of a = second-to-last axis of b. c must have the same size as the output column dimension (last axis of b), and broadcasting is allowed. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    affine(String, String, String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c and stores the result in the specified output tensor. Valid dot product requires last axis of a = second-to-last axis of b. c must match the output's column count and may be broadcasted regardless of its setting. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    and() - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise logical AND to the top two tensors in the queue.
    and(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise logical AND using the specified tensor as the first operand.
    and(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise logical AND using the two specified tensors.
    and(String, String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise logical AND using the two specified tensors and stores the result.
    arange(double, double, double) - Static method in class Tensor
    Creates a 1D tensor with values from start to less than end, with given step.

    C

    CalStat() - Method in class CuBridge
    Returns the current computation mode.
    cee() - Method in class CuBridge
    Computes the Cross-Entropy Error (CEE) loss between the top two tensors in the queue. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss. Both tensors must have the same shape. If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    cee(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Computes the CEE loss between the specified prediction tensor and the top target tensor. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss. Both tensors must have the same shape. If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    cee(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Computes the CEE loss between the specified prediction and target tensors. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss. Both tensors must have the same shape. If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    cee(String, String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Computes the CEE loss between the specified prediction and target tensors and stores the result. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss in the specified output tensor. Both tensors must have the same shape. If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    ceil() - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies ceiling operation (rounding up) for each element of the top tensor in the queue. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    ceil(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies ceiling operation (rounding up) for each element of the specified tensor. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    ceil(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies ceiling operation (rounding up) for each element of the specified tensor and stores the result. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    clear() - Method in class CuBridge
    Clears all tensors from the internal queue and memory.
    compress(int) - Method in class CuBridge
    Compresses the specified axis of the top tensor by summing its values. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    compress(int, boolean) - Method in class CuBridge
    Compresses the specified axis of the top tensor by either summing or averaging its values. Set avg to true to use average, or false to use sum. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    compress(String, int) - Method in class CuBridge
    Compresses the specified axis of the given tensor by summing its values. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    compress(String, int, boolean) - Method in class CuBridge
    Compresses the specified axis of the given tensor by either summing or averaging its values. Set avg to true to use average, or false to use sum. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    compress(String, int, boolean, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Compresses the specified axis of the given tensor by either summing or averaging its values and stores the result. Set avg to true to use average, or false to use sum. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    compress(String, int, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Compresses the specified axis of the given tensor by summing its values and stores the result under a new name. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    cos() - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies cosine (cos x) to the top tensor in the queue. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    cos(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies cosine (cos x) to the specified tensor. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    cos(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies cosine (cos x) to the specified tensor and stores the result under a new name. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge - Class in Unnamed Package
    CuBridge: A Java-CUDA bridge class for high-performance numerical computation.

    div() - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise division (a ÷ b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    div(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise division (a ÷ b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    div(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise division (a ÷ b) using the two specified tensors. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    div(String, String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise division (a ÷ b) using the two specified tensors and stores the result. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    dot() - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) between the last two axes of the top two tensors in the queue. The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b. All other axes must match. Use transpose() to reshape 1D vectors to (n,1) if needed.
    dot(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b. All leading axes must match. Reshape 1D vectors to (n,1) if necessary.
    dot(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) using the two specified tensors. The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b. All other axes must be equal. If either tensor is a 1D vector, use transpose() to convert it to (n,1).
    dot(String, String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) between the last two axes of the two specified tensors and stores the result. The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b. All leading axes must have the same shape; otherwise, the operation fails. Use transpose() to reshape 1D vectors to (n, 1) if needed.
    duple(String, int) - Method in class CuBridge
    Increases the usage count of an existing tensor in the execution queue. This method searches for a tensor with the given name in the current queue and increments its internal usage count. The tensor itself is not duplicated or copied; only its metadata is updated. Note: This operation is local to the execution queue and does not interact with the map. If the usage count is less than 1, or the tensor is not found in the queue, the operation fails.

    Resets the environment to auto-detection mode.
    EnvStat() - Method in class CuBridge
    Returns whether the system is in auto-detection mode.
    eq() - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise equality comparison (a == b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If the values are equal, returns 1; otherwise, returns 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    eq(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise equality comparison (a == b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. If the values are equal, returns 1; otherwise, returns 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    eq(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise equality comparison (a == b) using the two specified tensors. If the values are equal, returns 1; otherwise, returns 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    eq(String, String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies element-wise equality comparison (a == b) using the two specified tensors and stores the result. If the values are equal, returns 1; otherwise, returns 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.

    exp() - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies exponential function (exp) to the top tensor in the queue. Uses the formula: exp(x) = e^x for each element. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    exp(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies exponential function (exp) to the specified tensor. Uses the formula: exp(x) = e^x for each element. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    exp(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Applies exponential function (exp) to the specified tensor and stores the result under a new name. Uses the formula: exp(x) = e^x for each element. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    expand(int, int) - Method in class CuBridge
    Repeats the elements along the specified axis of the top tensor n times. This operation only works if the size of the given axis is exactly 1. If the condition is not met or the tensor is not found, an error message is printed and the operation fails.
    expand(String, int, int) - Method in class CuBridge
    Repeats the elements along the specified axis of the given tensor n times. This operation only works if the size of the given axis is exactly 1. If the condition is not met or the tensor is not found, an error message is printed and the operation fails.
    expand(String, int, int, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Repeats the elements along the specified axis of the given tensor n times and stores the result under a new name. This operation only works if the size of the given axis is exactly 1. If the condition is not met or the tensor is not found, an error message is printed and the operation fails.
    eye(int) - Static method in class Tensor
    Creates an identity matrix of size n x n.

    get() - Method in class CuBridge
    Retrieves and removes the top tensor from the internal queue. If the queue is empty, an error message is printed and null is returned.

    N

    put(Tensor, String, int) - Method in class CuBridge
    Stores a named tensor with a specific usage count.
    put(Tensor, String, int, boolean) - Method in class CuBridge
    Stores a tensor with complete configuration: name, usage count, and broadcasting flag. If the name is null or empty, an error is printed. If the usage count is 0 or negative (except -1), an error is printed. If the name already exists, the tensor will not be stored.

    Tensor - Class in Unnamed Package
    Tensor: A general-purpose multidimensional numerical array class for matrix and tensor operations.
    toString() - Method in class Tensor
    Returns a string representation of the tensor's shape.
    transpose() - Method in class CuBridge
    Transposes the last two axes of the top tensor in the queue. If the input is a 1D vector, it is automatically reshaped to a column vector (n, 1) before transposition. This operation does not affect leading axes (only the two innermost dimensions are swapped). If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    transpose(String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Transposes the last two axes of the specified tensor. If the input is a 1D vector, it is automatically reshaped to a column vector (n, 1) before transposition. This operation does not affect leading axes (only the two innermost dimensions are swapped). If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    transpose(String, String) - Method in class CuBridge
    Transposes the last two axes of the specified tensor and stores the result under a new name. If the input is a 1D vector, it is automatically reshaped to a column vector (n, 1) before transposition. This operation does not affect leading axes (only the two innermost dimensions are swapped). If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
